Label: Minimum DBH
helpText: minimum diameter of trees included in your inventory
Description: The minimum diameter of trees included in the inventory

Label: Year of measurement
helpText: if your Year is decimal, leave as "none" and match it to "Date of measurement"

Label: Month of measurement
helpText: numeric from 1 to 12

Label: Day of measurement
helpText: numeric from 1 to 31, different than date, see Date

Label: Date of measurement
helpText: In format like yyyy-mm-dd or decimal date etc...

Label: Cluster of plots
helpText: to group similar plots
Description: Cluster ID or name (This was created to accommodate ForestPlots network's cluster, which groups similar plots and is used by their data packages to create local allometries. Note that it is useful to also keep Site (PlotName) so as users able to check for duplicate datasets from multiple networks).

Label: Plot elevation
helpText: meters above sea leavel
Description: plot's elevation in meters above sea level

Label: Subplot area
helpText: none

Label: Plot View ID
helpText: additional plot protocol identifier
Description: additional plot protocol identifier useful to indicate if the plot protocol has changed and/or different soil type/disturbance... (This was created to accommodate ForestPlots network).

Label: Logging treatment
helpText: CL/RIL/control/..

Label: Plot latitude
helpText: in degrees

Label: Plot longitude
helpText: in degrees

Label: Subplot latitude
helpText: in degrees

Label: Subplot longitude
helpText: in degrees

Label: Number of living trees in the sampling unit
Description: Total number of living individuals per sampling unit

Label: Number of dead trees in the sampling unit
Description: Total number of dead individuals per sampling unit

Label: Tree Density
helpText: number of living tree individuals per area
Description: Density of living individuals per sampling unit

Label: What is your plot density unit?
Plot basal area density
helpText: total of living tree basal area in the sampling unit
Description: Total living tree basal area per sampling unit

Label: What is your plot basal area unit?
Plot volume
helpText: total of living tree volume in the sampling unit
Description: Total living tree volume per sampling unit

Label: What is your plot volume unit?
Number of species
helpText: in sampling unit

Label: Above ground biomass
helpText: of tree component
Description: Above ground biomass of the tree component of sampling unit, estimated using an allometric equation or another method

Label: What is your plot AGB unit?
Scientific name
helpText: Latin binomial

Label: Specific epithet
helpText: one word

Label: Determination rank
helpText: Deepest taxonomic level for which full identification is known
Description: Deepest taxonomic level for which full identification is known

Label: Taxonomic authority for the ID level
Description: Taxonomic authority for the ID level

Label: Commercial species indicator
Description: Logical: TRUE if species is considered commercial, FALSE if not

Label: Life form
helpText: tree/palm/liana/bamboo

Label: Life form(s) included in your data
Species abundance
helpText: Total number of individuals for a species, per sampling unit
Description: Total number of individuals for a species, per sampling unit

Label: Species total basal area
helpText: Total cross-sectional area of all stems of the species, per sampling unit
Description: Total cross-sectional area of all stems of the species, per sampling unit

Label: Species density
helpText: Tree density per area unit

Label: Species basal area density
helpText: total basal area per area unit

Label: Species Relative Density
helpText: in %

Label: Species Relative Dominance
helpText: in %

Label: Species Relative Frequency
helpText: in %

Label: Species Coverage Frequency
helpText: unitless

Label: Species Importance Index
helpText: unitless

Label: Inidividual tag
helpText: identifiers at the plot level. It can be the same as individual ID if you have only one plot.
Description: Tree unique identifiers, matching the tag number in the field.

Label: Individual ID
helpText: unique individual (tree) identifier in the entire dataset
Description: Tree unique identifiers. This was automatically generated if it was not provided in the input data (using plot and tree tag information).

Label: Stem tag
helpText: stem unique identifier within an individual

Label: Stem ID
helpText: unique stem identifier in the entire dataset
Description: Stem unique identifiers. This was automatically generated if it was not provided in the input data (using plot tree and stem tag information).

Label: Measure ID
helpText: if you measured more than one Diameter per tree or stem
Description: measure unique identifier if you had more than one measure per stem per year

Label: Tree latitude
helpText: in degrees

Label: Tree longitude
helpText: in degrees

Label: Tree X euclidean position in plot
helpText: position of the tree relative to the plot's coordinates, in meters
Description: Tree X euclidean position in plot

Label: Tree Y euclidean position in plot
helpText: position of the tree relative to the plot's coordinates, in meters
Description: Tree Y euclidean position in plot

Label: Tree X euclidean position in SUBplot
helpText: position of the tree relative to the SUBplot's coordinates, in meters
Description: Tree X euclidean position in subplot

Label: Tree Y euclidean position in SUBplot
helpText: position of the tree relative to the SUBplot's coordinates, in meters
Description: Tree Y euclidean position in subplot

Label: Live status
helpText: where you have clear value(s) to indicate a stem or tree is alive
Description: Logical: TRUE if tree was alive, FALSE if it was dead

Label: Dead status
helpText: where you have clear value(s) to indicate a stem or tree is dead. It can be the same column as Live status.

Label: DBH
helpText: usually at breast heigh but see HOM or POM

Label: BD
helpText: basal diameter

Label: Circumference
helpText: circumference of the tree

Label: HOM
helpText: height of diameter measurement, as numeric value

Label: POM
helpText: point of diameter measurement, if not measured as a continuous variable like HOM
Description: Code for point of measurement of tree diameter

Label: Basal HOM
helpText: height of basal diameter measurement, as numeric value
Description: Height of measurement of basal diameter

Label: Basal POM
helpText: point of basal diameter measurement, as a code
Description: Code for point of measurement of basal diameter

Label: Select all the columns that give information about your tree, and/or your methods of measurements
helpText: e.g. health, leaning, liana load, crown position...
Description: Codes associated to tree, separated by commas. The definition of each code is given in ...

Character separating Genus and Species in Scientific name
If you store multiple tree codes in one cell, what character separates each code?

Description: Column coming straight from the input data, without any correction or transformation

One of the column(s) indicated as tree codes, as it is in the input data. The name of it is Original_[colomn name in the input data]. See tree_codes_metadata.csv for the definition of each value. If the output profile you selected also had tree codes, and you applied the translation, you should also have a tree_codes_translation.csv file in the zipfile. That file explains the relationsip beetween the tree codes in your data and the tree codes in the output profile you turned your data into.

One of the column(s) storing tree code information. See tree_codes_translation.csv file to understand the relationsip beetween the tree codes in your data and the tree codes in the output profile you turned your data into.

source of the Genus and Species
correction

completed if information available at IdTree
level.
corrected trees diameter at default HOM

diameter correction methode = "taper"/"local linear regression"/"weighted mean"
/phylogenetic hierarchical("species"/"genus"/"family"/"stand")/"shift realignment"/"Same value".
POM value at which the corrected diameters are proposed. Corresponds to the 1st POM value at which the stem was measured
HOM value at which the corrected diameters are proposed. Corresponds to the DefaultHOM if Taper correction applied. If not, corresponds to the 1st HOM value at which the stem was measured
TRUE: the row was added to represent the year when the stem was larger than the minimum diameter, but absent from the dataset. FALSE: original dataset row.
